item.title: Product Hierarchy: Overview
item.description:
DefectDojo uses five main data classes to organize your work: Product Types, Products, Engagements, Tests, and Findings.

DefectDojo is made to be flexible to conform to your team, rather than making your team conform to the tool. You’ll be able to design a robust, adaptable workspace once you understand how these data classes can be used to organize your work.

item.title: Tags
item.description: Tags are ideal for grouping objects in a manner that can be filtered out into smaller, more digestible chunks. They can be used to denote status, or to create custom sets of Product Type, Products, Engagements or Findings across the data model.

item.title: Filter Index
item.description: Note: Currently this article only covers Finding Filters available in the DefectDojo Pro UI, but this article will be expanded in the future to govern more object types, along with Open-Source filters.

item.title: Link Findings to source code
item.description: Certain tools (particularly SAST tools) will include the associated file name and line number in vulnerability data. If the repository of the source code is specified in the Engagement, DefectDojo will present the filepath as a link and the user can navigate directly to the location of the vulnerability.

item.title: Product Health Grade
item.description: DefectDojo can calculate a grade for your Products based on the amount of Findings contained within. Grades are ranked from A - F.
